COPY JO. 321st February, 1941.WAR CABINET.COMMITTEE ON RECONSTRUCTION PROBLEMS.Composltioii and. Terms of Reference.The Prime Minister has approved' the appointmentof a Committee with the following terms of reference:-- -(a) To arrange for the preparation of practicalschemes of reconstruction, to which effectcan be given in a period of, say, three yearsafter the war. These plans should ha'^ as their general aim the perpetuation of thenational unity achieved in this country duringthe war,, through a social and economic structuredesigned to secure equality of opportunity and service among all classes of the community.(b) To prepare a scheme for a post-war european and world system, with particular regard to theeconomic needs of the various nations, and tothe problem cf adjusting the free life of smallcountries in a durable international order.2, The Committee has been constituted as follows:--The Minister without Portfolio (Chairman).The Lord Privy Seal.The Chancellor of the Exchequer.The Secretary of State for Dominion Affairs.The Minister of Works and Buildings.The Minister of Agriculture and Fisheries.The Minister of TransportsThe Minister of Health,The Secretary, Department of Overseas Trade.The Parliamentary Under-Secretary of State,Foreign Office.The Parliamentary Secretary, Board of Trade.Sir G, Cnrystal-, Secretary.3c Other Ministers will be invited to attend, or berepresented at, meetings of the Committee at which mattersof particular concern to their Departments are to be dealtwitha(Signed) E.E. BRIDGES.Secretary of the War Cabinet.Great George Street, S.W.1-.
